decks.notes: The main focus of this combo Dredge deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures and then use cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough to dredge through the deck, bringing back powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Ichorid. This graveyard synergy allows for explosive plays, overwhelming the opponent with tokens from Bridge from Below and combo potential with Lion's Eye Diamond. With efficient mana sources like Mana Confluence and Cephalid Coliseum, the deck aims to set up powerful plays and win the game through graveyard recursion and overwhelming board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a mix of counterspells and removal, while using card draw and manipulation to maintain card advantage. The deck focuses on efficiently dealing with threats using cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Counterbalance. The win condition is primarily through creating Angel tokens with Entreat the Angels or out-valuing the opponent with card advantage from cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, manipulating the top of the deck, and removing threats with board wipes and removal spells. Using cards like Counterbalance, Back to Basics, and Force of Will to disrupt opponents, while maintaining card advantage and card selection with Brainstorm, Predict, and Ponder. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Terminus and Supreme Verdict, as well as utilizing Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and controlling the game state.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively control the board while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler. The deck utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, Daze, and Spell Pierce to slow down the opponent, while also using removal like Lightning Bolt and Dismember. The deck aims to maintain tempo with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain, while also having some late-game value with Liliana, the Last Hope. Overall, the deck focuses on applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back into play for a devastating combo. By using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, Exhume, and Animate Dead, the deck aims to cheat big threats like Griselbrand and Grave Titan into play early in the game. The deck also includes disruption cards like Unmask and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures before they have a chance to establish their own board presence, leading to a quick victory.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly amass resources and mana to cast multiple spells in one turn in order to generate a large storm count, allowing for a game-winning spell to be cast such as Tendrils of Agony or Grapeshot. The deck utilizes cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Chrome Mox to accelerate its game plan, while also incorporating cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to find the necessary combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Duress and Thoughtseize to protect its combo.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board using a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Accumulated Knowledge and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to efficiently answer threats while staying ahead on cards with Brainstorm and Ponder, eventually resolving powerful win conditions like Entreat the Angels and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game. The inclusion of Counterbalance adds an additional layer of control, allowing the pilot to potentially counter spells without expending resources. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and eventually winning through powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using lands like Cloudpost and Glimmerpost, along with artifacts like Grim Monolith, to power out big Eldrazi creatures. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere disrupt opponents' strategies, while Thought-Knot Seer and Walking Ballista provide disruption and removal. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures like Matter Reshaper and Endbringer, eventually closing out the game with powerful finishers like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Kozilek, the Great Distortion. The deck's goal is to apply pressure and quickly close out the game with its high-impact threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through ritual effects, use card selection spells to find combo pieces, and then storm off by casting multiple spells in one turn to win the game. The deck focuses on playing powerful storm spells like Ad Nauseam and Empty the Warrens to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of tokens or a lethal storm count. The inclusion of Burning Wish allows for additional flexibility in finding key pieces from the sideboard to adapt to different matchups.

This deck revolves around quickly getting out powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using the combo of Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck aims to cheat these big creatures into play early in the game, sometimes as early as turn 1 or 2, to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can establish their own game plan. The deck also includes a variety of control elements such as Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage, removal, and disruption spells. It seeks to dominate the board with efficient threats like Snapcaster Mage and Gurmag Angler, while using cards like Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to filter through the deck and maintain a strong hand. The interaction of cards like Kolaghan's Command, Hymn to Tourach, and Diabolic Edict disrupts the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and grind out a win through careful resource management and powerful card selection.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to establish early control through disruption spells like Spell Pierce and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to maintain tempo with efficient cards like Lightning Bolt and Daze, and can also shift gears towards a more midrange game plan with cards like Gurmag Angler and True-Name Nemesis. The mana base is built to support the deck's low casting cost cards while also providing access to all three colors in order to maximize card choices.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies and controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By efficiently managing resources and manipulating the top cards of the library with Counterbalance, the player can dictate the flow of the game. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate card advantage and close out games. With a mix of tempo and card advantage, this UWx Control deck aims to outlast opponents and emerge victorious through careful decision-making and strategic play.

The main strategy of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt opponent's plays and control the game through a combination of counter spells, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and board wipes like Terminus to maintain board control. In addition, it includes cards like Counterbalance and Back to Basics to further stifle opponent's strategies and gain incremental advantage over time. This deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents by carefully managing resources and responses.

Control the game by using powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic, while disrupting the opponent with countermagic like Counterspell and Force of Will. Utilize cards like Back to Basics to lock down non-basic lands and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck focuses on early game aggression with Delver of Secrets and efficient removal with Swords to Plowshares. The key strategy is to control the tempo of the game, disrupt the opponent's plans, and close out the game with powerful threats like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte.

The main strategy of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through various forms of control, such as hand disruption with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, and counter spells like Force of Will. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to generate additional card advantage and control the board. In addition, the deck includes versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage and True-Name Nemesis to close out the game.
